alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued September 11 at 6:41PM MST until September 11 at 8:15PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 815 PM MST. * At 639 PM MST, an area of blowing dust was 7 miles northeast of Freeman, or 26 miles west of Casa Grande, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 173 and 204. AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 121 and 178. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 125 and 131, and between mile markers 136 and 153. Locations impacted include... Casa Grande, Coolidge, Maricopa, Estrella, Arizona City, La Palma, Blackwater, Toltec, Big Horn, Bosque, Bapchule, Freeman, Estrella Sailport, Olberg and Arizola. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
